keywords.reference: Ocean Vuong, 'On Earth We're Briefly Gorgeous'

lines.text: I dream of lost vocabularies that might express some of what we no longer can. — Jack Gilbert, *The Forgotten Dialect of the Heart*
It is not down in any map; true places never are. — Herman Melville, *Moby-Dick*
We are all broken, that's how the light gets in. — Ernest Hemingway
Time is the substance I am made of. — Jorge Luis Borges
We passed the setting sun — or rather, he passed us. — Emily Dickinson
Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world. — Eckhart Tolle
To see a World in a Grain of Sand. — William Blake, *Auguries of Innocence*
Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul. — Emily Dickinson
人之初，性本善。——佚名，*三字经*
